instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01055: What is 820-01055? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A2179: What is A2179? A2179 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2020 with EMC 3302, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01958..
definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.820-01958: What is 820-01958? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01055</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Sorry, the model for this board is 01958-a. I downloaded <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> is not the same, but it is what  have at the moment.
This plate suffered a lot of oxidation, <TRANSISTOR>Q7040</TRANSISTOR> and nearby components are well oxidized. The stresses I am not sure if I am measuring in the right place. L7816 and L7817 are with 34 Ohms in reference to the ground.

Voltage: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 1.2 V oscillating; <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> I don't know where to measure, follow the attached photo.[ATTACH type="full"]59536[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01055</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
"the model for this board is 01958-a"
You've probably meant 01598.
Check your PM for schematic.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01055</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> is the MBA 2020 (yes Apple always has to choose confusing numbers), schematics/boardview not available yet, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> can help indeed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01055</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Post diode mode to ground at <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>/60 and L7030.
Do you get any voltage at <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>?
